content:
Is it possible to use gitpod or codespaces or something else to give people a "one click install" of the pfr project?

LTE had its examples directory and Bhavik wrote a main results file for Ramsey. These are attempts to show mathematicians something about what is going on. With a one-click install you could imagine adding some exercises to the project for people interested in the mathematics, and who wanted to try Lean themselves.

Are there any parts of this project which would lead to good Lean exercises for mathematicians?
Oh I see I didn't include a gitpod link in the readme! Let me fix that quick.
Fixed. Tell me if it works (from in the README and the website, the latter being updated in ~25min).

Yup, I got it working both in browser and in local VS Code, although for some reason the VS Code version had errors which went away when I built the project on the command line.

Is it possible to make a link to a specific file in the repo? I just got a blank page and a suspicion that the installation procedure had finished...
